main event: Two observers in Lebanon, Oregon observed a single luminous object in the sky that exhibited an oscillating movement.
interesting points: The object was visible for over an hour and was not detected on radar., One witness suggested the object could be a star affected by atmospheric conditions., The object appeared to have the same intensity as the North Star., The observations were made at an angle of 45 degrees to 98 degrees from the initial sighting., The report was compiled under Project Blue Book by the United States Air Force.
witness description: Roland Hoklund (civilian) and M/Sgt Thomas J. Arms (Air Force)
